content:
TITLE: Creating Scoped Storage with TypeScript DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to create a scoped storage instance with TypeScript, including type definitions for the schema and scope. This example creates an account-scoped storage with a language setting. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/src/storage/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` type AccountSchema = { language: `${string}-${string}`; }; type DID = `did:${string}`; const account = new Storage< [DID], AccountSchema >({ id: 'account', }); account.set( ['did:plc:abc', 'language'], 'en-US', ); const language = account.get([ 'did:plc:abc', 'language', ]); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Device Storage in TypeScript DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the device storage instance for setting, getting, removing, and removing multiple items. This example uses the base level scope for device-wide storage. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/src/storage/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { device } from '#/storage'; device.set(['foobar'], true); device.get(['foobar']); device.remove(['foobar']); device.removeMany([], ['foobar']); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing and Using ALF Atoms in React TSX DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to import and apply atomic styles using the ALF framework. Atoms are static style definitions that match Tailwind CSS selectors and are reused throughout the app. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/src/alf/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { atoms } from '#/alf' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Basic Header Layout with Layout.Header Components DESCRIPTION: Shows how to compose a basic header using the Layout.Header subcomponents, including the BackButton, Content area with title and subtitle, and the Slot component for balanced spacing. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/src/components/Layout/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` {/* or */} Account {/* Optional subtitle */} Settings for @esb.lol ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complete Basic Layout Implementation Example DESCRIPTION: Provides a complete example of the most basic layout structure available, combining Layout.Screen, Header components, and Content area in the recommended structure. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/src/components/Layout/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` {/* or */} Account {/* Optional subtitle */} Settings for @esb.lol ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using the Bluesky Logger in TypeScript DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to import and use the Bluesky logger, including creating custom instances, using different log levels, and proper error handling. The example shows all available log methods: debug, info, log, warn, and error. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/src/logger/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { logger, Logger } from '#/logger' // or, optionally create new instance with custom context // const logger = Logger.create(Logger.Context.Notifications) // for dev-only logs logger.debug(message, {}) // for production breadcrumbs logger.info(message, {}) // seldom used, prefer `info` logger.log(message, {}) // for non-error issues to look into, seldom used, prefer `error` logger.warn(message, {}) // for known errors without an exception, use a string logger.error(`known error`, {}) // for unknown exceptions try { } catch (e) { logger.error(e, {message: `explain error`}]) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Memoization Patterns with Lingui DESCRIPTION: Illustrates correct and incorrect patterns for memoizing translated content while maintaining proper locale change reactivity. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/docs/localization.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` import { msg } from "@lingui/macro"; import { i18n } from "@lingui/core"; const welcomeMessage = msg`Welcome!`; // âŒ Bad! This code won't work export function Welcome() { const buggyWelcome = useMemo(() => { return i18n._(welcomeMessage); }, []); return
{buggyWelcome}
; } // âŒ Bad! This code won't work either because the reference to i18n does not change export function Welcome() { const { i18n } = useLingui(); const buggyWelcome = useMemo(() => { return i18n._(welcomeMessage); }, [i18n]); return
{buggyWelcome}
; } // âœ… Good! `useMemo` has i18n context in the dependency export function Welcome() { const linguiCtx = useLingui(); const welcome = useMemo(() => { return linguiCtx.i18n._(welcomeMessage); }, [linguiCtx]); return
{welcome}
; } // ðŸ¤© Better! `useMemo` consumes the `_` function from the Lingui context export function Welcome() { const { _ } = useLingui(); const welcome = useMemo(() => { return _(welcomeMessage); }, [_]); return
{welcome}
; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Translating Accessibility Labels with useLingui Hook DESCRIPTION: Shows how to translate dynamic text and accessibility labels using the useLingui hook and msg macro. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/docs/localization.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` // Before import { Text } from "react-native"; const text = "Hello World"; {text} ``` LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` import { msg } from "@lingui/macro"; import { useLingui } from "@lingui/react"; const { _ } = useLingui(); return {text} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic String Translation with Trans Macro in JSX DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to wrap static text content with the Trans macro for internationalization support. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/docs/localization.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` // Before import { Text } from "react-native"; Hello World ``` LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` // After import { Text } from "react-native"; import { Trans } from "@lingui/macro"; Hello World ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Theme-Dependent Styles in ALF DESCRIPTION: Shows how to combine atomic styles with theme-dependent values such as colors using the useTheme hook. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/src/alf/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` const t = useTheme() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Customizing Header Layout for SavedFeeds Screen DESCRIPTION: Shows how to customize the header layout for specific needs, such as aligning content to the left and adding a custom wider button, as used in the SavedFeeds screen. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/src/components/Layout/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` {/* Override to align content to the left, making room for the button */} Edit My Feeds {/* Custom button, wider than 34px */} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Screen Layout Structure in React DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the conceptual structure of layouts on individual screens, showing the general pattern of Outer, Header, and Content components. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/src/components/Layout/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ```
...
... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Responsive Breakpoints in ALF DESCRIPTION: Example of using breakpoint utilities to implement responsive UI logic using the useBreakpoints hook. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/src/alf/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` const b = useBreakpoints() if (b.gtMobile) { // render tablet or desktop UI } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Non-React Translation Using t Macro DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to translate strings outside of React components using the t macro, noting that it won't react to dynamic locale changes. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/docs/localization.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import { t } from "@lingui/macro"; const text = t`Hello World`; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Header Slot for Right-Side Button DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the Layout.Header.Slot component to position a button on the right side of the header, as shown in the Hashtag screen example. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/src/components/Layout/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Flashlight Performance Tests for Bluesky Social App DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates various commands for running Flashlight performance tests on the Bluesky Social App. It includes commands for live preview, running specific tests, and viewing test results. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/docs/testing.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` yarn perf:measure yarn perf:test:measure yarn:perf:results yarn perf:test ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Maestro E2E Tests for Bluesky Social App DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the commands to run Maestro E2E tests for the Bluesky Social App. It involves running a mock server, a metro bundler, and the actual test execution in separate terminal tabs. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/docs/testing.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` - In one tab, run `yarn e2e:mock-server` - In a second tab, run `yarn e2e:metro` - In a third tab, run `yarn e2e:run` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Android Badge Count Fix Implementation DESCRIPTION: Documentation for a patch that addresses badge count clearing issues on Android by replacing ShortcutBadger's setCount method with direct Android API calls for more reliable badge management. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/patches/expo-notifications+0.29.11.patch.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ### `setBadgeCountAsync` fix on Android `ShortcutBadger`'s `setCount` doesn't work for clearing the badge on Android for some reason. Instead, let's use the Android API for clearing the badge. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Important Android Notification Module Patch DESCRIPTION: Critical patch for Android background notification handling that enables message processing in onMessageReceived and allows setting notification channel ID from the data payload instead of the notification object. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/patches/expo-notifications+0.29.11.patch.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ## LOAD BEARING PATCH, DO NOT REMOVE ## Expo-Notifications Patch This patch supports the Android background notification handling module. Incoming messages in `onMessageReceived` are sent to the module for handling. It also allows us to set the Android notification channel ID from the notification `data`, rather than the `notification` object in the payload. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Uploading iOS Sourcemaps to Sentry after OTA Updates DESCRIPTION: Command to upload iOS sourcemaps to Sentry after an OTA update. This command specifies the release name, update ID, and paths to the bundle and sourcemap files for proper error tracking on iOS. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/docs/build.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` node_modules/@sentry/cli/bin/sentry-cli releases \ files \ upload-sourcemaps \ --dist \ --rewrite \ dist/bundles/main.jsbundle dist/bundles/ios-.map ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Uploading Android Sourcemaps to Sentry after OTA Updates DESCRIPTION: Command to upload Android sourcemaps to Sentry after an OTA update. This command specifies the release name, update ID, and paths to the bundle and sourcemap files for proper error tracking. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/docs/build.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` node_modules/@sentry/cli/bin/sentry-cli releases \ files \ upload-sourcemaps \ --dist \ --rewrite \ dist/bundles/index.android.bundle dist/bundles/android-.map ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Go Server Build and Run Commands DESCRIPTION: Commands to build and run the Go server for serving the web app in production SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/docs/build.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` cd social-app yarn && yarn build-web cd bskyweb/ go mod tidy go build -v -tags timetzdata -o bskyweb ./cmd/bskyweb ./bskyweb serve --appview-host=https://public.api.bsky.app ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building Web Bundle for SPA DESCRIPTION: Command to build the monolithic static JavaScript file (bundle.web.js) for the SPA from the top level of the repository. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/bskyweb/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # in the top level of this repo yarn build-web ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Web Development Server for SPA DESCRIPTION: Command to start the yarn web development server for local development and testing of the SPA. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/bskyweb/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # run yarn web dev server, if you wanted yarn web ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building Golang Daemon Binary DESCRIPTION: Command to build the Golang daemon into a standalone binary named 'bskyweb' that can be deployed or run directly. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/bskyweb/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # build and output a binary go build -o bskyweb ./cmd/bskyweb/ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Golang Daemon in Development Mode DESCRIPTION: Command to rebuild and run the Golang daemon using go run, which compiles and executes the code in one step for development purposes. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/bskyweb/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # re-build and run daemon go run ./cmd/bskyweb serve ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Share Extension Plugin Documentation in Markdown DESCRIPTION: This markdown document outlines the implementation steps for integrating share extensions into Expo applications for both iOS and Android platforms, including necessary file modifications and build configurations. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/plugins/shareExtension/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` # Share extension plugin for Expo This plugin handles moving the necessary files into their respective iOS and Android targets and updating the build phases, plists, manifests, etc. ## Steps ### ios 1. Update entitlements 2. Set the app group to group. 3. Add the extension plist 4. Add the view controller 5. Update the xcode project's build phases ### android 1. Update the manifest with the intents the app can receive ## Credits Adapted from https://github.com/andrew-levy/react-native-safari-extension and https://github.com/timedtext/expo-config-plugin-ios-share-extension/blob/master/src/withShareExtensionXcodeTarget.ts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing oEmbed Link for Bluesky Social Posts in HTML DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to include an oEmbed link in HTML for embedding Bluesky Social posts. It specifies the alternate link type and the oEmbed API endpoint with necessary parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/bskyweb/README.embed.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Bluesky Post Blockquote in HTML DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the HTML structure for embedding a Bluesky post using a blockquote. It includes placeholders for post text, author information, and a link to the original post. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/bskyweb/README.embed.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```

{{ post-text }}

— US Department of the Interior (@Interior) May 5, 2014
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Android ADB Port Forwarding Command DESCRIPTION: Command to enable localhost access for Android simulator SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/docs/build.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` adb reverse tcp:{PORT} tcp:{PORT} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: iOS Simulator Runtime Installation Commands DESCRIPTION: Commands for setting up iOS simulator runtime and Xcode configuration SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/docs/build.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` xcode-select -s /Applications/Xcode.app xcodebuild -runFirstLaunch xcrun simctl runtime add "~/Downloads/iOS_17.4_Simulator_Runtime.dmg" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Environment Setup Commands for iOS Ruby Configuration DESCRIPTION: Series of commands to set up Ruby environment with rbenv and install correct dependencies for iOS development SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/docs/build.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` brew install rbenv rbenv install 2.7.6 rbenv global 2.7.6 eval "$(rbenv init - zsh)" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting up Node.js Environment for SPA Bundle DESCRIPTION: Commands to install Node.js using nvm, set the current version, and install yarn globally as a prerequisite for building the SPA bundle. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/bskyweb/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # install nodejs nvm install nvm use npm install --global yarn ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Project Dependencies for SPA Bundle DESCRIPTION: Command to install project dependencies using yarn with the frozen-lockfile flag to ensure consistent installations across environments. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/bskyweb/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # setup tools and deps (in top level of this repo) yarn install --frozen-lockfile ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Web Crawler Permissions in robots.txt for Bluesky Social App DESCRIPTION: This robots.txt configuration allows crawlers to access all content on the domain while providing advice about using the official API for bulk operations. It notes that rate limiting is implemented via HTTP 429 status codes, with a recommendation that a few concurrent requests should be acceptable. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/bskyweb/embedr-static/robots.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: robots.txt CODE: ``` # Hello Friends! # If you are considering bulk or automated crawling, you may want to look in # to our protocol (API), including a firehose of updates. See: https://atproto.com/ # By default, may crawl anything on this domain. HTTP 429 ("backoff") status # codes are used for rate-limiting. Up to a handful concurrent requests should # be ok. User-Agent: * Allow: / ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Crawling Permissions in robots.txt for Bluesky Social App DESCRIPTION: This robots.txt configuration allows all user agents to crawl the entire domain. It mentions that rate limiting is implemented via HTTP 429 responses and suggests that a small number of concurrent requests should be acceptable. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/bskyweb/static/robots.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: robots.txt CODE: ``` # Hello Friends! # If you are considering bulk or automated crawling, you may want to look in # to our protocol (API), including a firehose of updates. See: https://atproto.com/ # By default, may crawl anything on this domain. HTTP 429 ("backoff") status # codes are used for rate-limiting. Up to a handful concurrent requests should # be ok. User-Agent: * Allow: / ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Robots.txt to Disallow Crawling for Development BlueSkySocial Web App DESCRIPTION: This robots.txt configuration blocks all web crawlers from indexing any content on a development or self-hosted instance of the BlueSkySocial web application. It uses the wildcard User-Agent to apply the rule to all crawlers and disallows access to the entire site. SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app/blob/main/bskyweb/static/robots-disallow-all.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: robots.txt CODE: ``` # This is an development or self-hosted instance of the bsky web app, and crawling has been disallowed by the operator team. User-Agent: * Disallow: / ```
